question.content: Which state gives the annual award Guru Kelucharan Mohapatra?

solution.content: Odisha. Kelucharan Mohapatra (Odissi dancer) - First person to receive the Padma Vibhushan (2000) from Odisha. Arts awards Kalidas Samman (Madhya Pradesh), Jakanachari Award (Karnataka), Kala Ratna Award (Andhra Pradesh), Tulsi Samman (Madhya Pradesh), Kalaimamani Award (Tamil Nadu), Rashtriya Kumar Gandharva Samman (Madhya Pradesh), Varnashilpi Venkatappa Award (Karnataka), Poompuhar State Award (Tamil Nadu).

question.content: Guru Gangadhar Pradhan Award is given in which field of art?

solution.content: Dance. Guru Gangadhar Pradhan - An eminent Odissi exponent. He founded both the prestigious Orissa Dance Academy as wellas Konark Natya Mandap. Awards Padma Shri (2008), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1997).

question.content: What is the frequency of the Kalidas Samman?

solution.content: Once in a year (by the Government of Madhya Pradesh). Kalidas Samman - First awarded in 1980. First Recipients (1980-81):- Semmangudi Srinivasa lyer (Classical Music), Mallikarjun Mansur (Classical Music).

question.content: Which of the following performance categories belongs to Guru Kelucharan Mohapatra and Guru Kelucharan Mohapatra Yuva Prativa Summan ?

solution.content: Odissi dance and music. Guru Kelucharan Mohapatra Award was instituted in the year 1995 by Shri Ratikant Mohapatra to confer recognition on individuals for their contribution to the fields of Dance, Music, Cinema and Theatre. Award amount 1,00,000 rupees.

question.content: In which of the following categories did Anindita Neogy Anaam receive National Nritya Shiromani award?

solution.content: Kathak.

question.content: The Guru Kelucharan Mohapatra Yuva Pratibha Samman 2021 was presented to Arushi Mudgal for_ dance.

solution.content: Odissi - Classical dance forms which originated in the Hindu temples of the eastern coastal state (Odisha).

question.content: Which Indian musician won the Grammy award for 'A Meeting by The River' with Ry Cooder in 1994?

solution.content: Vishwa Mohan Bhatt. He is a 'Mohan veena' player. Awards: Padma Bhushan (2017), Padma Shri (2002), Sangeet Natak Academy (1998). Other Veena Players: Zia Mohiuddin Dagar, Sundaram Balachander, Emani Sankara Shashtri, Gopal Shankar Misra.

question.content: Which Indian musician was awarded the Grammy award for his Album 'Planet Drum'?

solution.content: Zakir Hussain (Tabla Maestro): Awards Padma Vibhushan (2023), Kalidas Samman (2006), Padma Bhushan (2002), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1990), Padma Shri (1988).

question.content: The National Award for Classical Dance is called.

solution.content: Abhinandan Saroja Award. It is presented by the National Institute of Classical Dance to the dancers and choreographers for their contribution towards preserving the rich traditional classical dance form of India. 2021 Award Winner - Aparna Satheesan who is an exponent of Bharatnataym and Kuchipudi dance.

question.content: Instituted in 1984, the National-level Lata Mangeshkar Award is given to promote excellence in the area of light music annually by the government's culture department.

solution.content: Madhya Pradesh. Lata Mangeshkar (her honorific titles such as the "Queen of Melody", "Voice of the Millennium") was an Indian playbo5/25 singer and music composer. Naushad, (a) Kathakali (b) Bharatanatyam (c) Kathak (d) Odissi Sol.434.(a) (Kathakali). Award 2009. Kalamandalam Sangeet Natak Rajan Akademi

question.content: Ustad Hassu Khan, Ustad Haddu Khan and Ustad Nathu Khan were exponents of the Gharana.

solution.content: Gwalior. The Gwalior Gharana (Gwalior school of classical music) is one of the oldest Khayal Gharana in Indian classical music.

question.content: Who among the following Indian musicians was a part of a band named 'Planet Drum' along with Mickey Hart, Sikiru Adepoju, and Giovanni Hidalgo, whose first album received the 1992 Grammy Award for Best World Music Album, which was the first Grammy in this category?

solution.content: Zakir Hussain.

question.content: With which of the following classical dances is 'Kottakkal Sivaraman' associated?

solution.content: Kathakali. Arts Awards

question.content: Instituted in 1984, the National-level Lata Mangeshkar Award is given to promote excellence in the area of light music annually by the _ government's culture department.

solution.content: Madhya Pradesh. Lata Mangeshkar (her honorific titles such as the "Queen of Melody", "Voice of the Millennium") was an Indian playback singer and music composer. Naushad, Kishore Kumar, and Asha Bhosle are among the earlier recipients of the Lata Mangeshkar Award.

question.content: Which of the following presents awards and recognitions in the field of Indian dances?

solution.content: Sangeet Natak Akademi: The apex body in the field of performing arts in the country, was set up in 1953. The Chairman of the Akademi is appointed by the President of India for a term of five years. Sahitya Akademi (1954): Headquarter - Rabindra Bhawan, Delhi. Lalit Kala Akademi (1954)- Headquarters Rabindra Bhavan, Delhi. INTACH - Indian National Trust for Art and Cultural Heritage (1984). Headquarter - New Delhi.

question.content: Guru Gopinath National Award 2021 was honoured to whom among the following Kathak dancers?

solution.content: Kumidini Lakhia, an Indian Kathak dancer and choreographer. Awards - Padma shri (1987), Padma Bhushan (2010). "Guru Gopinath Desiya Natya Puraskaram" is the highest award conferred by the Government of Kerala for excellence in dance.

question.content: Who among the following performing artists bagged the best actress award for Meena Gurjari in 1975?

solution.content: Mallika Sarabhai (Bharatanatyam and kuchipudi dancer). Awards: Padma Bhushan (2010).

question.content: Select the correct statement about the achievements of Sruti Bandyopadhyay, an eminent Manipuri dancer.

options.text: She received Padma Shri for the year 2020.
She received the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award for the year 2020.
She received Kalidas Samman for the year 2020.
She received Padma Vibhushan for the year 2020.

answer: She received the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award for the year 2020.

solution.content: Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (2020). She is awarded with the Visiting Lecturer Fulbright Fellowship (2007) and the Academic Staff Commonwealth Fellowship (2012) to lecture and perform on Indian dances in the USA and UK respectively.

question.content: Noted dancer Birju Maharaj bagged the Filmfare award for best Choreographer for which film in 2016?

solution.content: Bajirao Mastani (Song Mohe Rang Do Laal).

question.content: won the National Award for the Best Music Director for his music album in the movie 'Viswasam' at the 67th National Award Graduate Level 30/06/2023 (Shift -1)

solution.content: D Imman. M. M. Keeravani (musical composer) Padma Shri (2023), Academy Award for Best Music (RRR Song) - Naatu Naatu, Golden Globe Award for Best Original Song 2023 Naatu Naatu, National Film Award for Best Music Direction,1998 - Annamayya.

question.content: Devdas Smriti Panthi Dance Award is related to which state? Matric Level 28/06/2023 (Shift - 1)

solution.content: Chhattisgarh. Awards of Chhattisgarh - Guru Ghasidas Samman, chakradhar Samman, Devdas Banjare Memorial Award, Kishore Sahu Samman. Awards of Madhya Pradesh Kalidas Samman, Kabir Samman, Tansen Samman, Kishore Kumar Samman, Lata Mangeshkar Award, Maithilisharan Gupta Award, Devi Ahilyabai Award, Iqbal Samman. Awards of Uttar Pradesh Vishwa Bharti Award, Maharshi Valmiki Award, Maharishi Vyas Award, Maharshi Nara Award, Ved Pandit Award.

question.content: Who among the following singers has received the Dadasaheb Phalke Award?

solution.content: Asha Bhosle (48th). Other recipients of Dadasaheb Phalke Award: Asha Parekh (68th), Rajnikanth (67th), Amitabh Bachchan (66th). The Award is named after Dhundiraj Govind Phalke (Dada saheb falke) ("Father of Indian Cinema"); his first directed film was 'Raja Harishchandra' in 1913. The first recipient of the award was Devika Rani in 1969.

question.content: How much purse money was given to a Sangeet Natak Akademi fellow in 2019?

solution.content: 3 lakh. Sangeet Natak Akademi Fellowship: Awarded for the performing arts in India, Sponsored by (Sangeet Natak Academy), First awarded (1954: Allauddin Khan, Hafiz Ali Khan, Ariyakudi Ramanuja lyengar, Karaikudi Sambasiva lyer, and Prithviraj Kapoor).

question.content: For which year was Manna Dey honored with the Dadasaheb Phalke Award?

solution.content: 2007. Manna Dey belonged to the Bhendi Bazaar Gharana and was trained under Ustad Aman Ali Khan.

question.content: How much purse money was given to a recipient of the Akademi Award in 2019 ?

solution.content: 1 Lakh and a copper Shield. Sahitya Akademi Award: {Established (1954), Given in 24 languages). The award amount, which was Rs. 5,000 since inception. This award is presented annually by the Sahitya Akademi (National Academy of Letters).

question.content: When was the Sri Shanmukhananda National Eminence Award set up?

solution.content: 2002. Awardee 2002- Shri Semmangudi Srinivasaiyer (Carnatic Vocal), 2018- Zakir Hussain (Tabla), 2019- Dr. Umayalpuram Sivaraman (Mrudangam) and Kalyanapuram Shri. R. Aravamudachariar (Harikatha). 2020- Pandit Arvind Parikh (Hindustani Sitar).

question.content: Which of the following fields is not offered by Kalidas Samman?

solution.content: Puppetry is an animated visual art form. Kalidas Samman (2020)- Aruna Sairam Indian Music (Carnatic Music). This award is presented annually by the Government of Madhya Pradesh.

question.content: B Herambanathan who was awarded with the 'Sangeet Natak Akademi Award' in 2013 is a _ dancer.

solution.content: Bharatanatyam. He is the senior most choreographer and dance teacher of the Thanjavur nattuvanga tradition. In 1989, he established Thanjavur Bavu Pillai School of Bharatanatyam in Thanjavur.

question.content: Who among the following Bharatanatyam exponents received the 'Chevalier of Arts and Letters award from the Government of France in 2004?

solution.content: Alarmel Valli. She is an exponent of the Pandanallur style (Bharatnatyam).

question.content: The Kalaimamani awards are given in which of the following states of India?

solution.content: Tamil Nadu. The Kalaimamani is the highest civilian award in the state of Tamil Nadu, India. It is awarded for best in Arts. It was first awarded in 1954.

question.content: Which Indian dancer was awarded the French Palme D'or by the French Government in 1977?

solution.content: Mallika Sarabhai is a Kuchipudi and Bharatanatyam dancer from Gujarat. Her writings include 'In free fall: My experiments with living'. Chitra Visweswaran (Bharatanatyam dancer), Oopali Operajita (classical Odissi and Bharatanatyam dancer), and Kavya Madhavan (Bharatanatyam).

question.content: 'Ustad Bismillah Khan Yuva Puraskar' is given by which of the following bodies?

solution.content: Sangeet Natak Akademi (formed in 1953). Ustad Bismillah Khan Yuva Puraskar' is given to outstanding artists under the age of 40 who have demonstrated talent in the fields of music, dance and Theatre. First awarded- 2006. National School of Drama (1959), Bhartiya Vidya Bhavan (1938).

question.content: Who gives the Bharat Muni Samman?

solution.content: Nalanda Dance Research Centre. Bharat Muni Samman (started in 2011). In 1966, this centre was established by Kanak Rele (exponent of Mohiniyattam) in Mumbai.
